# update(context:)

**Instance Method**

Updates entities up to once every scene update.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @preconcurrency mutating func update(context: SceneUpdateContext)
```

## Parameters

- **context**: The scene context for the scene to update.

## Discussion

RealityKit calls this method on all registered systems, as often as the `updatingSystemWhen` parameter of [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SceneUpdateContext/entities(matching:updatingSystemWhen:)] defines.

The `context` parameter contains a reference to the scene that the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/System] is updating, along with the elapsed time since RealityKit last called the update method for the same scene. Use [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SceneUpdateContext/entities(matching:updatingSystemWhen:)] inside this method for the most optimized way to find the matching entities for this [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/System].

## Implementing system logic

- **SceneUpdateContext**: An object that contains information about the scene to update.
- **EntityQuery**: An object that retrieves entities from a scene.
- **QueryPredicate**: An object that defines the criteria for an entity query.
- **QueryResult**: An object that returns the results of an entity query.
